Name: tgrelid
Description: the table this trigger is on

Name: tgparentid
Description: parent trigger that this trigger is cloned from, zero if not a clone; this happens when partitions are created or attached to a partitioned table.

Name: tgname
Description: trigger name (must be unique among triggers of same table)

Name: tgtype
Description: bit mask identifying trigger firing conditions

Name: tgenabled
Description: controls in which session_replication_role modes the trigger fires. o = trigger fires in "origin" and "local" modes, d = trigger is disabled, r = trigger fires in "replica" mode, a = trigger fires always.

Name: tgisinternal
Description: true if trigger is internally generated (usually, to enforce the constraint identified by tgconstraint)

Name: tgconstrrelid
Description: the table referenced by a referential integrity constraint

Name: tgconstrindid
Description: the index supporting a unique, primary key, referential integrity, or exclusion constraint

Name: tgconstraint
Description: the pg_constraint entry associated with the trigger, if any

Name: tgdeferrable
Description: true if constraint trigger is deferrable

Name: tginitdeferred
Description: true if constraint trigger is initially deferred

Name: tgnargs
Description: number of argument strings passed to trigger function

Name: tgattr
Description: column numbers, if trigger is column-specific; otherwise an empty array

Name: tgargs
Description: argument strings to pass to trigger, each null-terminated

Name: tgqual
Description: expression tree (in nodetostring() representation) for the trigger's when condition, or null if none

Name: tgoldtable
Description: referencing clause name for old table, or null if none

Name: tgnewtable
Description: referencing clause name for new table, or null if none
